result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defense is waiting for additional discovery and an offer.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on January 9, 2023 at 10:00 am.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on September 12, 2022 - APPROVED**

9:39 AM Defendant Kenneth L Timm Jr in court.  Attorney Donna Kuchler for John M Binder in court for Kenneth L Timm Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.

Letter to Court dated July 26, 2022 re: Victim(s) to appear via zoom.
Reviewed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on July 26, 2022 - APPROVED.**

10:05 AM Defendant Kenneth L Timm in court with attorney John M Binder.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared by zoom with victim witness specialist by zoom.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter to Court from State re: victim allow to appear via zoom, filed by District Attorney.
**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on July 5, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Arraignment on July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

08:15 AM Defendant Kenneth L Timm in court with attorney John M Binder.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appeared by Zom with victim/witness specialist Holly Dischler who appeared by Zoom.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Detective Thomas Johannik, of the City of New Berlin Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Sitzberger.
Cross examination by attorney Binder.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Attorney Binder reqeusts an arraignment date.
The Court will adjourn the matter.

ADA Sitzberger requests that the Defendant turn over the apartment key of Victim A.
Attorney Binder does not object.
The Court orders the Defendant to return the apartment key of Victim A, if he has it.  Arraignment scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State's request for zoom link
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 06-28-2022. Granted
Defendant returned copy of summons filed by District Attorney office (from 6/2 initial appearance)
Preliminary hearing on July 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

08:39 AM Defendant Kenneth L Timm in court with attorney John M Binder.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
